snippet: Investigators ruled that the statute of limitations had run out in the case of a physician charged with negligence after a lawyer under her care died in custody in 2009.
abstract: Russian investigators, ruling that the statute of limitations has run out, drop charges against Larisa A Litvinova, the former prison doctor who was charged with negligence after Sergei L Magnitsky, a lawyer under her care, died in custody in 2009; decision is latest twist in case that drew international criticism over Russia's selective and sometimes brutal justice system.
lead_paragraph: Investigators ruled that the statute of limitations had run out in the case of a physician charged with negligence after a lawyer under her care died in custody in 2009.

headline.seo: Russia Drops Charges Against Doctor in Jail Death
headline.main: In Russia, Charges Are Dropped in Jail Death
headline.print_headline: In Russia, Charges Are Dropped In Jail Death
